snippet: Mild cognitive impairment, or M.C.I., involves a decline in mental acuity noticeable by oneself and others but not severe enough to be diagnosed as dementia.
abstract: Study by Paul A Newhouse published in journal Neurology finds that a nicotine patch worn for six months can improve attention, memory and mental processing in people with mild cognitive impairment.
lead_paragraph: Mild cognitive impairment, or M.C.I., involves a decline in mental acuity noticeable by oneself and others but not severe enough to be diagnosed as dementia.

headline.seo: Nicotine Patch Helps Against Cognitive Impairment in Study
headline.main: Nicotine Patch Helps Against Cognitive Impairment in Study
headline.print_headline: Aging: Nicotine Patch Helps Against Cognitive Impairment in Study
